intro: Threlkeldia inchoata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps it conserve water in harsh conditions. Threlkeldia inchoata is adapted to withstand drought and temperature extremes, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
